attributes.action: Give adult children living in the Marital Family Home more rights during divorce
attributes.additional_details: Adult children who are still living in the MFH should have more rights over their access to the MFH when parents divorce. For instance, when a parent forcefully removes the child from the home and then changes the locks and does not let them access their belongings or see family pets. When a parent will not be reasonable with the children nor the other partner and will not allow them to be able to collect belongings, collect/see pets, or have any access at all to the house that was their home.
attributes.background: Give adult children still living in the Marital Family Home more rights when their parents separate/divorce and they are still living in the MFH - but are suddenly made to leave by a parent. Allow them to access the MFH to obtain belongings and access family pets etc.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about managing access to property, possessions and family pets are a matter for individual families and, in the event of a dispute, the courts, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
